benchmark_details.name: ESTR-CoT (Event Stream based Scene Text Recognition with Chain-of-Thought Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: The ESTR-CoT framework improves both the accuracy and interpretability of scene text recognition by integrating chain-of-thought reasoning within event stream inputs, producing both recognition results and reasoning processes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To propose a novel reasoning-based framework for event stream scene text recognition that enhances model interpretability and accuracy.

data.source: Constructed via a three-stage process involving generation, polishing, and expert verification.
data.annotation: Expert verification and structured multi-stage dataset curation.

methodology.calculation: BLEU scores calculated at character and word levels for Chinese and English, respectively.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BLEU scores indicate better linguistic accuracy and reasoning quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparative performance metrics against traditional STR methods.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against three event-based scene text recognition benchmark datasets.
